guide.title: Which form of taxation to choose when starting a business?
guide.subtitle: Comparison of tax scale, flat tax, and lump sum

intro.title: Introduction
intro.description: Personal Income Tax (PIT) is a mandatory levy that entrepreneurs must pay on their income. Choosing the right form of taxation is one of the most important decisions when starting a business, which can significantly affect the amount of taxes paid.
intro.factors: The choice of taxation form depends on many factors, including:
intro.factor4: Plans for joint settlement with spouse

when.title: Who and When Must Choose a Form of Taxation?
when.point1: By the 20th day of the month following the month of obtaining the first income
when.point2: By the end of the tax year if the first income was obtained in December
when.note: When choosing the tax scale, no notification is required - it is the default form of taxation.

taxScale.title: 1. General rules taxation (tax scale)
taxScale.adv1: Possibility of joint settlement with spouse
taxScale.obl1: Maintaining revenue and expense ledger or accounting books
taxScale.obl2: Calculating and paying monthly tax advances

flatTax.title: 2. Flat tax (19%)
flatTax.adv3: Ability to deduct social security contributions
flatTax.lim1: No possibility of joint settlement with spouse
flatTax.lim2: No access to most tax reliefs
flatTax.lim3: Cannot provide services to former employer
flatTax.example: Entrepreneur with annual income of 200,000 PLN will pay tax: 200,000 PLN × 19% = 38,000 PLN (with tax scale it would be: 120,000 PLN × 12% + 80,000 PLN × 32% = 40,000 PLN)

lumpSum.title: 3. Lump sum on recorded revenue
lumpSum.adv3: Ability to deduct social security contributions
lumpSum.example: Programmer (liberal profession) with annual revenue of 100,000 PLN will pay: 100,000 PLN × 17% = 17,000 PLN (regardless of incurred costs)

summary.title: Summary
summary.taxScale1: With lower incomes (up to 120,000 PLN annually)
summary.taxScale2: When you want to settle jointly with spouse
summary.taxScale3: When you use many tax reliefs
summary.flatTax2: When you have significant business costs
summary.flatTax3: When you don't plan to use tax reliefs
summary.lumpSum1: When you have low business costs
summary.lumpSum2: With favorable lump sum rate for your industry
summary.note: Remember: Choosing the form of taxation is an individual decision that should take into account the specifics of your business. If in doubt, it is worth consulting an accountant or tax advisor.
